turns.content: A full electric circuit includes a power source (such as a battery or generator), a conductor (such as a wire), and a device that uses electricity (such as a light bulb or motor). The power source provides a flow of electrical energy, which flows through the conductor and into the device. The device then converts the electrical energy into a useful form, such as light or motion. In a complete circuit, the electrical energy flows from the power source, through the device, and back to the power source, creating a continuous loop. The key components of a full electric circuit are a power source, conductors, and a load.
what happens when two bulbs are in parallel connection

When two bulbs are connected in parallel, they are connected to the same power source, but each bulb has its own separate electrical path. This means that the electrical current is divided between the two bulbs, and each bulb receives the same voltage as the power source.

In this configuration, if one bulb burns out, the other bulb will continue to function because they are connected separately. Also, the brightness of each bulb will not be affected by the other bulb, so if one bulb is brighter or dimmer, it will not affect the other.

In summary, in parallel connection, the current is divided among the connected devices, and each device receives the same voltage as the source, and devices work independently of each other.
what do you understand by parallel combination of bulbs

A parallel combination of bulbs refers to a configuration in which multiple light bulbs are connected to the same electrical power source, but each bulb has its own separate electrical path. This means that the electrical current is divided between the bulbs, and each bulb receives the same voltage as the power source. This is opposed to a series combination of bulbs, in which the bulbs are connected in a chain, and the current flows through each bulb in sequence, and the voltage is divided among the bulbs.

In a parallel combination, each bulb is connected directly to the power source, and each bulb has its own separate electrical path. This means that if one bulb burns out or is removed, the other bulbs will continue to function because they are connected separately. Also, the brightness of each bulb will not be affected by the other bulbs, so if one bulb is brighter or dimmer, it will not affect the other.

In summary, the parallel combination of bulbs is a configuration in which multiple light bulbs are connected separately to the same power source and the current is divided among the bulbs. This configuration has the advantage of allowing the individual bulbs to function independently of each other.
